contentrichtext.text: {{For|the languages of southern Africa|Xun language (disambiguation)}} [[File:Xunfront.jpg|thumb|right|140px|The front of a glazed pottery ''xun'', showing blowing hole and six finger holes]] [[File:Xunback.jpg|thumb|right|140px|The back of a glazed pottery ''xun'', showing blowing hole and two thumb holes]] [[File:Recording of Xun.ogg]] The '''''xun''''' ({{zh|s=[[wiktionary:埙|埙]]|t=[[wiktionary:塤|塤]]|p= xūn}}) is a [[wikt:globular|globular]], [[flute]]-like, [[List of Chinese musical instruments|Chinese musical instrument]]. The xun was initially made of stone or bone,<ref name=xunocarinaforest>{{cite web | publisher = ocarinaforest.com | title = The Chinese Xun | url = http://ocarinaforest.com/ocarinas/chinese-xun/ | accessdate = 2012-12-30 }}</ref> and later of [[clay]] or [[ceramic]]. It is similar to an [[ocarina]] but without a [[fipple]] [[Mouthpiece (woodwind)|mouthpiece]]. Other Chinese flute-like instruments, such as the Wudu and Taodi, however, include a fipple. ==Components== The ''xun'' is made in several [[Egg (food)|egg]]-shaped sizes, and is one of the oldest Chinese instruments. It has a blowing hole on top and generally eight smaller finger holes (one for the index, middle, and ring fingers of each hand, and one for each thumb). The Korean equivalent is the ''[[Hun (instrument)|hun]]'' (hangul: [[wiktionary:훈|훈]]; hanja: [[wiktionary:塤|塤]]). In Japan, the same type of instrument is called ''[[tsuchibue]]'' (hiragana: つちぶえ ; kanji: 土笛, lit. "earthen flute"). ==See also== *[[Ocarina]] *[[Chinese flutes]] *[[Traditional Chinese musical instruments]] *[[Music of China]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.melodyofchina.com/06instruments/xun.html Image and sound files] *[http://music.yahoo.com.cn/search?pid=ysearch&p=%DB%F7&mimetype=all&source=ysearch_music_result_topsearch Xun audio] (click headphones to listen to individual tracks) The Xun looks similar to a small oil burner. {{Traditional Chinese musical instruments}} [[Category:Chinese musical instruments]] [[Category:Vessel flutes]] {{woodwind-instrument-stub}} {{china-music-stub}} [[ko:훈]]
